ygData.subject: Re: VARIOUS THOUGHTS
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I ve run across this two or three times.  Sounds like a sound glitch (the music plays in one key for a bit, then switches to another, repeat).  Zoning
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 24 May 1999, FLEX DOLPHYNN wrote:
>
> C: Often when I play my songs my music sounds very strange. I was
> wondering if any others have experienced this. It definately sounds as if
> my Mandolin is out of tune, which would give credence to the usefullness of
> Lute Tuners. But the effects still seem to work full power. When I ask my

I've run across this two or three times. Sounds like a sound
glitch (the music plays in one key for a bit, then switches to
another, repeat). Zoning seems to fix it. At least they got
rid of the bug where you get two songs playing at once (your
bard music, and the local "theme" background music). Maybe
they're related?

Who or what are Lute Tuners?

> the music sounds exactly like a mis-tuned instrument so I was wondering if
> this is a feature of the game telling me to buy a new Mandolin or
> something.

I have been using the same mandolin since L8, and haven't
noticed any problems.

> E: Buy songs in advance. The songs we get are scattered all over. Buy
> the songs only available in your city levels in advance before you leave to
> go get new songs. Just store them in the bank. This makes it so you do
> not
> have to travel back to Kelethin or Erudin to get your song. Plan in
> Advance, it is not that hard to do.

Good advice, but if you're trying to save money for armor or
weapons you need NOW, you may regret it. I've been doing a
lot of travel lately (have actually lost one bubble in
experience for the weekend due to intermittent deaths), and
once you get to learn the lands, the trip from Kelethin to
Erudin is not that outrageous. If you get lucky and don't
have to wait long for the boats, you should be able to make it
in just over an hour. I've just decided to start adventuring
in the area that holds my next song. I get to see more of the
world that way (elephants and centaurs and mermaids, oh my).

Also, some of the songs are just not worth the trip, and I've
deferred those until I happen to be in the area (the Charisma
and Identify songs in particular).

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
